message.content: Yes, the authors report error bars in their experiments. For example, in Figure 1 (Power vs Sample-Size) of the main text, they mention that the error regions in the figure correspond to one bootstrap standard deviation with 200 bootstrap samples. This indicates that they have taken into account the variability of their experiments across multiple runs.

Yes, the authors report error bars in some of the experiments. For instance, in the details for Figure 1, they mention that the error regions in the figure correspond to one bootstrap standard deviation with 200 bootstrap samples.

Yes, the authors report error bars in their experiments. For example, in Figure 1's second figure, they mention that the error regions correspond to one bootstrap standard deviation with 200 bootstrap samples. This shows that the authors have taken into account the variability arising from multiple runs of the experiments and reported error bars accordingly.
